bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Environmental Management Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a contravention of a prescribed provision of the Act or the regulations,
a failure to comply with an order under the Act, or
a failure to comply with a requirement of a permit or approval issued or given under the Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: determination means a determination for the purposes of section 115 (1) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice respecting administrative penalty

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a director intends to make a determination in respect of an alleged contravention or failure by a person, the director must, before making the determination, give notice in writing to the person.
The notice under subsection (1) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the name of the person who is the subject of the notice,
a description of the circumstances that gave rise to the alleged contravention or failure,
the person's right to make representations under section 3, and
a preliminary assessment of the amount of the administrative penalty, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: identify

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the prescribed provision of the Act or the regulations the person is alleged to have contravened,
the order the person is alleged to have failed to comply with, or
the requirement of a permit or approval the person is alleged to have failed to comply with.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Opportunity to make representations

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before making a determination in respect of an alleged contravention or failure by a person, a director must provide the person with an opportunity to make representations in respect of the alleged contravention or failure.
A person wishing to make representations under subsection (1) must make a request, in writing, to the director within 30 days after the date the person receives the notice under section 2.
Subject to subsection (4), if a person makes a request in accordance with subsection (2), the director

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must conduct a written, electronic or oral hearing, or any combination of them, as the director, in the director's sole discretion, considers appropriate, and
may

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: determine the circumstances and place in which, and the process by which, the hearing may be conducted, and
specify the form and content of materials to be provided for the hearing, and the date the materials must be provided.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person does not provide materials to the director in accordance with subsection (3) (b) (ii), the director is not required to conduct a hearing.

If, after giving an opportunity to make representations, a director does not make a determination in respect of an alleged contravention or failure by a person, the director must give notice to the person that the person is not required to pay an administrative penalty.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Determinations
bcl:section.bcl:text: A determination must be in a form that includes all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the reasons for the decision;
the name of the person who is liable for the administrative penalty;
the contravention or failure in relation to which the administrative penalty is imposed;
the amount of the administrative penalty;
when the administrative penalty must be paid;
the person's right to an appeal under Division 2 of Part 8 of the Act;
the address of the appeal board.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Correction of determination

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Within 15 days after the date a determination is made, the director who made the determination may amend the determination to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: correct a typographical, an arithmetical or another similar error, and
correct an obvious error or omission.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The discretion given to a director under subsection (1) is exercisable with or without a hearing and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on the initiative of the director who made the determination, or
at the request of the person who is the subject of the determination.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a director corrects a determination under subsection (1),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the director must give notice in writing to the person who is the subject of the determination, and
the correction does not take effect until the date the person receives notice of the correction under paragraph (a).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Absolute liability
bcl:section.bcl:text: A requirement that a person pay an administrative penalty applies even if the person exercised due diligence to prevent the contravention or failure in relation to which the administrative penalty is imposed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Assessment of administrative penalty

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In establishing the amount of an administrative penalty in a particular case, a director must consider the following matters, if applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the nature of the contravention or failure;
the real or potential adverse effect of the contravention or failure;
any previous contraventions or failures by, administrative penalties imposed on, or orders issued to the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the person who is the subject of the determination;
if the person is an individual, a corporation for which the individual is or was a director, officer or agent;
if the person is a corporation, an individual who is or was a director, officer or agent of the corporation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: whether the contravention or failure was repeated or continuous;
whether the contravention or failure was deliberate;
any economic benefit derived by the person from the contravention or failure;
whether the person exercised due diligence to prevent the contravention or failure;
the person's efforts to correct the contravention or failure;
the person's efforts to prevent recurrence of the contravention or failure;
any other factors that, in the opinion of the director, are relevant.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a contravention or failure continues for more than one day, separate administrative penalties, each not exceeding the applicable maximum administrative penalty, may be imposed for each day the contravention or failure continues.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Date administrative penalty must be paid
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who is the subject of a determination must pay the administrative penalty within 30 days after the later of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date the determination is served on the person,
if, under section 5 of this regulation, the determination was corrected, the date the person receives notice of the correction, or
if, under Division 2 of Part 8 of the Act, the person appeals the imposition of an administrative penalty,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the date the person receives a copy of the order or decision of the appeal board, if the appeal board confirms or varies the administrative penalty, or
the date a new determination is served on the person, if the appeal board sends the matter back, with directions, to the director who made the determination.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Enforcement of administrative penalty
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a person fails to pay an administrative penalty as required under section 8, the person is not eligible to apply for a permit or approval, or to amend a permit or approval, until the penalty is paid in full.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Consolidated revenue fund
bcl:section.bcl:text: All revenue derived from administrative penalties must be paid into the consolidated revenue fund.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Limitation period
bcl:section.bcl:text: A notice under section 2 may not be served more than 3 years after the later of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date the alleged contravention or failure to which the notice relates occurred, or
the date evidence of the alleged contravention or failure first came to the knowledge of a director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 6 (2), (3) or (4), 7, 8, 9 (1) or (4), 11, 25 (2), 40 (1), (2), (6) or (7), 40.1 (2), 48 (8), (10) or (15), 55 (1.1) or (1.3), 55.1 (2), 72 (1) or (2), 76.2, 91.11 (1) (a) or (4), 91.2 (2) or 91.41 (4) of the Act is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.

A person who contravenes section 10 (1), (2) or (3), 91.11 (1) (b) or (c) or (2) or (3) (a), (c) or (d), 91.2 (1) (a) or (b) or (c) (i) or (ii) or (6) (a) (i) or (ii) or (b), 91.31 (6) (b), 91.51 (1) or (2), 91.71 (1) (a), (b), (c) or (d), 109 (6) or 111 (2.1) of the Act is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 91.11 (1) (d) or (e) or (3) (b), 91.2 (6) (c), 91.31 (6) (a) or (c) or 91.71 (2) of the Act is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.
A person who contravenes section 12 (2) or 13 of the Act is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $2 000.
A person who fails to comply with an order under the Act is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

A person who fails to comply with a requirement of a permit or approval issued or given under the Act is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000, unless the requirement the person failed to comply with is also a prescribed provision of the Act or the regulations that is subject to a different maximum administrative penalty.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Code of Practice for Agricultural Environmental Management

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes any of sections 11 (2), 27 (1) (a), 34 (a) (ii) or (d), 40 (a.2) (ii) or (d), 43.2 (a) (ii) or (d), 47 (1), 51 (1) (b), 52 (1) (b) (i), 60 (2), 62 (b) or (d) (ii) and 75 (1) (b) of the Code of Practice for Agricultural Environmental Management is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.

A person who contravenes any of sections 3 (2), 10 (1), 14, 22 (d), 24 (c), 26, 30, 33 (2) (a) or (b), 34 (f), 36 (2), 37 (1) (b) or (d) or (2), 38 (2), 40 (f), 42 (1) (b) or (2), 43 (2) to (4), 43.1 (1), 43.2 (f), 51 (2), 52 (2), 59 (1) (a) or (c), 64 (4), 65, 68 (f), 71 (1) (d), (2) (a) or (3), 72 (2), 73 (5), 74 (1) (d), (2) (c) or (3), 75 (2) (a), 76, 78 (3) (a) or (e) and 79 of the Code of Practice for Agricultural Environmental Management is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Antifreeze Regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 2 of the Antifreeze Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Antisapstain Chemical Waste Control Regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 2, 4 (1), 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11 or 12 of the Antisapstain Chemical Waste Control Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Asphalt Plant Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 2 (3), 5 (1) or (4), 7 (2), 9, 11, 12 (1) or (2), 13.1 (5), 14 (2), 15, 16 (2) or 17 (1) of the Asphalt Plant Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.

A person who contravenes section 5 (2) or (3), 6 (1), (2) or (3), 7 (1), 13 (1) or (3), 13.1 (1), 14 (1), 17 (2) or (3) or 18 (1) of the Asphalt Plant Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 3.1, 6 (4), 8, 13 (5) or (6), 13.1 (2) or 16 (1) of the Asphalt Plant Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Cleaner Gasoline Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 4 (2) of the Cleaner Gasoline Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.
A person who contravenes section 2 (2) or (3), 3 (1) or 10 (1) (a) of the Cleaner Gasoline Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 2 (4), 9 or 10 (1) (c) or (d), (2), (7) or (8) of the Cleaner Gasoline Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Prescribed provisions of Code of Practice for Industrial Non-Hazardous
Waste Landfills Incidental to the Wood Processing Industry

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14 (1), 15 (5), 16, 19 (1), 20 (1), 21 (1) or 22 (1) of the Code of Practice for Industrial Non-Hazardous Waste Landfills Incidental to the Wood Processing Industry is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

A person who contravenes section 15 (1) or (3), 17 (1) or (4), 18 or 22 (4) of the Code of Practice for Industrial Non-Hazardous Waste Landfills Incidental to the Wood Processing Industry is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Code of Practice for Soil Amendments

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 2, 3 (1), 4, 5 (2), 6, 7 (1), (2) or (3), 8 (1), 9 (2) or (4), 10 or 11 (1) of the Code of Practice for Soil Amendments is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 7 (4), 9 (3) or 12 of the Code of Practice for Soil Amendments is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Code of Practice for the Concrete and Concrete Products Industry

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 3, 4, 5, 6 (1), 7 (1), 8 (1) or 10 the Code of Practice for the Concrete and Concrete Products Industry is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 9 or 11 of the Code of Practice for the Concrete and Concrete Products Industry is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Code of Practice for the Slaughter and Poultry Processing Industries

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 18 of the Code of Practice for the Slaughter and Poultry Processing Industries is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.

A person who contravenes section 5 (a), 6, 7, 8, 9 (1) or (2), 9.1, 10 (1) or (2), 11 (1), 14 (1), (2) or (4), 15, 16 (1), 19 (1), 20, 21, 22, 23 (1), 24 (2), 25 (2), 26 (1) or (2), 27 or 29 (5) of the Code of Practice for the Slaughter and Poultry Processing Industries is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

A person who contravenes section 3, 5 (b) or (c), 9 (3), 11 (2), 12, 13, 16 (2), 19 (4), 23 (2) or (3), 25 (3), (4) or (6), 26 (3) or (4), 28 (2) or 29 (1) or (2) of the Code of Practice for the Slaughter and Poultry Processing Industries is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Contaminated Sites Regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 3.2 (1), (2) or (3), 3.4, 46 (1), 46.1 (1) or (7), 57 (1) or (1.2), 59 (1) or 60.1 of the Contaminated Sites Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Environmental Data Quality Assurance Regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 2 of the Environmental Data Quality Assurance Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Environmental Impact Assessment Regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 2 or 3 of the Environmental Impact Assessment Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Gasoline Vapour Control Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 2 (1) or (5), 3 (7), 4 (1), (2), (4), (5) or (8), 5 (1), (2), (4), (5) or (6), 6 (1), (2), (3), (4), (5), (6), (8) or (9) or 7 of the Gasoline Vapour Control Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 3 (6), 4 (6) or (7) or 9 (1) or (2) of the Gasoline Vapour Control Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Land-based Finfish Waste Control Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 6 (1) or 7 (1) of the Land-based Finfish Waste Control Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 5 or 8 of the Land-based Finfish Waste Control Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Landfill Gas Management Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 4 (1) or (5), 5 (3), 7 (1) or (2), 8 (3) or (4) (b), 9 (1), 11 (3) or 15 (1) of the Landfill Gas Management Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

A person who contravenes section 6 (2), 7 (3), 8 (4) (a), 10, 11 (1) or (2), 12 (3), 13, 14 or 15 (4) of the Landfill Gas Management Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Repealed
Prescribed provisions of Municipal Wastewater Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 45, 50, 94 (1), 97 (1), 108 (1), 109 (2), (3), (4), (5) or (6), 111 (2) or (3), 112, 113, 115 (1) or 117 (2) or (3) of the Municipal Wastewater Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.

A person who contravenes section 16 (1), 42 (2), 46, 49 (2) (a), 55 (5), 57 (4), 62, 63, 64, 65 (1), 66 (4), 97 (2), 101, 103 (3) or 118 (3) of the Municipal Wastewater Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Mushroom Compost Facilities Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 1, 2 (1) or 3 (0.1), (1) or (4) of the Schedule to the Mushroom Compost Facilities Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 2 (3), 3 (2), 4 (1) or (2) or 5 (1) or (3) of the Schedule to the Mushroom Compost Facilities Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Oil and Gas Waste Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 3 or 5 (2) or (3) of the Oil and Gas Waste Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.
A person who contravenes section 7 (3) or (4) or 8 of the Oil and Gas Waste Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 6 (2), (3) or (4) of the Oil and Gas Waste Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Open Burning Smoke Control Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 12, 17 or 30 (4) of the Open Burning Smoke Control Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.
A person who contravenes section 9, 10, 11, 13, 14 or 15 of the Open Burning Smoke Control Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 31 of the Open Burning Smoke Control Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Organic Matter Recycling Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 5 (1), 7 (2) or (4), 9 (2), 12 (4) or (5), 14 (2), 15 (1), 17, 20 (2), 22 (1), 23 (2) or (3), 24 (1), 25 (1), 26 (2) or (3), 27, 28, 29 or 30 of the Organic Matter Recycling Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

A person who contravenes section 5 (3) or (4), 7 (3), 9 (3) or (6), 15 (2) or (3), 23 (4), 24 (2) or (3) or 25 (2) of the Organic Matter Recycling Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Ozone Depleting Substances and Other Halocarbons Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 4 (1), (3) or (4), 11, 13, 15, 17, 18, 19, 22 or 27 (1), (2), (5) or (7) of the Ozone Depleting Substances and Other Halocarbons Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.

A person who contravenes section 5, 6 (3), 7 (1) or (3), 8 (a), 10 (1) or (2), 12 (1), (3) or (4), 14, 16, 20, 21, 24, 25, 26 or 28 of the Ozone Depleting Substances and Other Halocarbons Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 8 (b), 9, 10 (3) or 27 (6) of the Ozone Depleting Substances and Other Halocarbons Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Petroleum Storage and Distribution Facilities Storm Water Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 4, 5 or 6 (1), (3), (4), (6), (7), (8), (9), (10) or (13) of the Petroleum Storage and Distribution Facilities Storm Water Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 6 (5), (11) or (12) or 7 of the Petroleum Storage and Distribution Facilities Storm Water Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Pulp Mill and Pulp and Paper Mill Liquid Effluent Control Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 2 (1), (1.1), (3), (5) or (6) of the Pulp Mill and Pulp and Paper Mill Liquid Effluent Control Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.
A person who contravenes section 5 (1) of the Pulp Mill and Pulp and Paper Mill Liquid Effluent Control Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 5 (5) of the Pulp Mill and Pulp and Paper Mill Liquid Effluent Control Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Recycling Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 2 (1), (2) or (3), 4, 6, 8 (1), 11 (2) or 14 (1) (a) or (2) of the Recycling Regulation, or
section 5 (1) or (2), 6 (1), 7 or 8 of Schedule 1 of the Recycling Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 2 (4) or (5), 9 (4), 10, 11 (3) or (4), 12 or 14 (1) (b), (3) or (4) of the Recycling Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Solid Fuel Burning Domestic Appliance Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 4 (3) of the Solid Fuel Burning Domestic Appliance Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.
A person who contravenes section 4 (4), (5) or (6) or 7 (2), (3), (4), (5) or (6) of the Solid Fuel Burning Domestic Appliance Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

A person who contravenes section 2 (1), 6 (1) or 9 (1) (a) or (b) or (2) (a) or (b) of the Solid Fuel Burning Domestic Appliance Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Spill Contingency Planning Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 3 of the Spill Contingency Planning Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

A person who contravenes section 4, 5 (1) or (2), 6 (1) or (2), 7 (1) or (2), 8, 9 (1), 10, 11 (1) or 12 (1), (2), (3) or (4) of the Spill Contingency Planning Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Spill Preparedness, Response and Recovery Regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 6, 9, 10 or 11 of the Spill Preparedness, Response and Recovery Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Spill Reporting Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 4 (1) of the Spill Reporting Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.
A person who contravenes section 7 (3) of the Spill Reporting Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.
A person who contravenes section 4 (2), 5 or 6 of the Spill Reporting Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Repealed
Prescribed provisions of Storage of Recyclable Material Regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 4 (1) or (2) or 5 (1) of the Storage of Recyclable Material Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Repealed
Prescribed provisions of Vehicle Dismantling and Recycling Industry Environmental Planning Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 2 (2) or (3), 4 (1), 5 (1) or 6 of the Vehicle Dismantling and Recycling Industry Environmental Planning Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $40 000.

A person who contravenes section 2 (4) or (5), 4 (2) (a) or (c), 5 (2) (a), (b), (c) or (e), (3) or (4) or 7 of the Vehicle Dismantling and Recycling Industry Environmental Planning Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $10 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of Wood Residue Burner and Incinerator Regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 2 (1) of the Wood Residue Burner and Incinerator Regulation is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $75 000.
